result.execSummary:
The defendant Marlena J Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marlena J Rodriguez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marlena J Rodriguez was found guilty of Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $8901.53 plus surcharges; jointly & severally with 15CF1064.
May not have contact with Daniel P or his family, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.
*  Pay extradition costs of $92.72.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Video from parking lot viewed in court.  Victim present and addressed.  Court imposes a total sentence of 20 years WSP:  10 years initial confinement w/credit for 339 days served; 10 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; restitution ordered in the amount of $8,901.53 (by stipulation of deft), joint & several with 15CF1064; extradition costs ordered in the amount of $92.72 (by stipulation of deft); deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge.  No contact with Daniel P. or his family.
